humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there is metastatic carcinoma in nine out of twenty-one lymph nodes (N2) in the left axillary contents. This is confirmed by New Rule 14, which states that N2 indicates metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes. The report also mentions metastatic carcinoma in the sentinel lymph node, but the N stage is determined by the number of positive lymph nodes in the regional lymph nodes, which in this case is the left axillary contents. Therefore, the N stage is N2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic carcinoma present in 9 out of 21 lymph nodes, with the largest lymph node metastasis measuring 5.0 mm in greatest microscopic dimension. This indicates a pathologic N2 stage.
